publications.name: Functional Gene Correction for Cystic Fibrosis in Lung Epithelial Cells Generated from Patient iPSCs
publications.summary: This study highlights the use of CRISPR technology to correct the CFTR gene mutation in induced pluripotent stem cells (iPSCs) derived from cystic fibrosis patients. The corrected cells were differentiated into airway epithelial cells, restoring normal CFTR expression and function.

publications.name: Autologous and Heterologous Cell Therapy for Hemophilia B toward Functional Restoration of Factor IX
publications.summary: This research explores cell-based therapies for Hemophilia B, including the use of corrected iPSCs differentiated into hepatocyte-like cells and the transplantation of cryopreserved human hepatocytes, offering a potential long-term cure for the disease.

publications.name: LARP4 is an RNA-binding protein that binds nuclear-encoded mitochondrial mRNAs to promote mitochondrial function
publications.summary: The study identifies LARP4 as a critical RNA-binding protein that regulates nuclear-encoded mitochondrial mRNAs, ensuring proper mitochondrial biogenesis and function by maintaining the expression of respiratory chain complex proteins.
